thread.title: Ground News - Driver who was killed in Christmas Day crash identified
thread.title_full: Ground News - Driver who was killed in Christmas Day crash identified

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Driver who was killed in Christmas Day crash identified
text:
Summary by Ground News The man who died in a Christmas Eve shooting at The Citadel mall has been identified as 18-year-old Teryus Thomas of Colorado Springs. The El Paso County Coroner's Office conducted an autopsy of Thomas on Tuesday and will determine the cause and manner of death. Currently, his death is being investigated as a homicide. KRDO Center High Factuality Media Conglomerate: News-Press & Gazette Company Christmas Eve Citadel Mall shooting victim identified COLORADO SPRINGS, Colo. (KRDO) - The Colorado Springs Police Department (CSPD) says that 18-year-old Teryus Thomas was killed in a shooting at the Citadel Mall on Christmas Eve. CSPD responded to a shots-fired call where they found that a fight had broken out between two groups of people. Police say two other men were injured in the shooting but are in stable condition. Officers found Thomas dead at the scene from a gunshot wound. CSPD is inv…
